page.title: 06CROFTING IN SKERRIES
page.content:
Crofting in Skerries has decreased over the years. The old people say that when they were younger the whole island was covered in{rigs}(small patches of cultivated land) but now there are only a few rigs left on the island.{Potatoes}and{oats}are the main crops grown in Skerries. Also, a few people grow{Shetland {Cabbage}in yards near their houses. In earlier days these cabbages were grown in{krubs}(little round yards surrounded by stone dykes).
No-one in Skerries has a{cow}now although there used to be a lot of them here. The last one was sold in the{1960's.}The sheep which are kept here are all{Shetland sheep}and most households have a few sheep. A few people also keep{hens}and{ducks.
